content.description: Start low on the south side of the boulder. Use a few moves to get over the lip, and top out.
content.protection: A pad wouldn't be the end of the world.
content.location: Coming from old sandwich road, hike in via the powerlines past the big water tank. The boulder is about 20 feet off the path on your left, roughly opposite the road to the fire tower.

content.description: This area is in a meandering pitch pine forest with extensive mountain bike paths and the occasional boulder. It is hardly a destination for climbing, but the hills offer some nice hiking/biking, and there's a cool firetower near the center. Most of the boulders are not much more than ~6 feet tall, but there are a few nice tops/traverses. The area could make for a fun afternoon exploring. The powerlines make for a nice direct approach, and from there, you can take one of the many paths off into the woods to explore. The snapchat map offers a surprisingly accurate map of the trails here.
